title: What Does the Lock Mean on Snapchat?

steps.title: The lock appears on Snapchat stories that are private.
steps.content: The lock appears on Snapchat stories that are private. Typically, Snapchat stories are public for anyone on your friends list to see. However, you can create custom Snapchat stories for specific audiences. But how do you know if a story is private? It has a ðŸ”’ on it! [1] X Research source When a story is private, unapproved friends wonâ€™t see a story in their feed. The lock only appears on stories. Regular snaps are sent individually, so youâ€™ll only see a normal snap if it was meant for you in the first place. The lock will be purple if you havenâ€™t watched a private story yet, or gray if youâ€™ve viewed it. Itâ€™s also gray in your profile if you want to make your own custom story. If youâ€™re brand new to Snapchat, a story refers to snaps that you post for people to open at their leisure. Unlike normal snaps you send individually, a story wonâ€™t pop up in someoneâ€™s inbox.

steps.title: Yes, the fact that you can see the story means itâ€™s meant for you.
steps.content: Yes, the fact that you can see the story means itâ€™s meant for you. The story wouldnâ€™t pop up in your feed if you werenâ€™t able to view it. This means that your friend went out of their way to select your name so that you could see the story. [2] X Research source You should feel honored! The lock simply means that other people may not be able to view the story.

steps.title: People make private stories because itâ€™s faster than sending snaps.
steps.content: People make private stories because itâ€™s faster than sending snaps. If you know that you want to send a single snap to a large number of people, crafting a private story is a tad bit faster than shooting a regular snap and sending it out to a bunch of people individually. Sending the individual snaps isnâ€™t a massive time sink, but making a private story is just a lot more streamlined. You can select who views your story from an alphabetized contact list. In contrast, when you send a normal snap, your friends list is sorted based on streaks (how often you send them snaps), which can be kind of clunky to sift through.

steps.title: A user might make a story private to keep certain people from seeing it.
steps.content: A user might make a story private to keep certain people from seeing it. Private stories are a great way to invite specific people to a party or share personal news without letting everyone see it. If youâ€™re only trying to share something with a specific group of people (like close friends, coworkers, or family members), a private story will prevent folks you only talk to occasionally from seeing it. If you accept random friend requests, making a story private is a good idea if youâ€™re revealing any personal info on the app . Itâ€™s better to be safe than sorry! You may also want to hide a story if youâ€™re doing something in a snap that certain people may not approve of. If youâ€™ve got a sibling who hates people who drink, you may want to block them from seeing footage of you at a party, for example.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon in the Snapchat app.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon in the Snapchat app. Open the Snapchat app and log in, if necessary. Then, press the profile icon in the top left of your screen to open your home screen. [3] X Research source You can also get to this screen by pressing your Bitmoji or the story thumbnail when you open the app.

steps.title: Press New Private Story and select the friends you want to see it.
steps.content: Press New Private Story and select the friends you want to see it. The New Private Story button is under the Add to My Story button, which is under the "My Stories" heading. Tap that button. Now, tap on every user in your friends list who youâ€™d like to see your story. [4] X Research source This is a key difference between posting a private story and sending individual snaps. When you send a normal snap, you select who to send it to after you shoot the video or take a photo. If you've already created a private story, you can access it by tapping Add to [name]'s Private Story . You can create a new private story by tapping the yellow + New Story button and choosing New Private Story .

steps.title: Tap Create Story.
steps.content: Tap Create Story . You'll be prompted to give your story a name. Tap Done to finalize the name. This will create your private story for the people you selected.

steps.title: Tap Add to [name]'s Private Story.
steps.content: Tap Add to [name]'s Private Story . The [name] will be replaced with your display name on Snapchat.

steps.title: Choose a Snap or photo, or record something new.
steps.content: Choose a Snap or photo, or record something new. Shoot your video or take your photo. Add whatever widgets or filters youâ€™d like and press the send button (itâ€™s that little paper airplane in the bottom right). [5] X Research source Your story will now appearâ€”with the lock symbol on itâ€”in the feed of anyone approved to view it! There are three ways you can add content to your private story: The Snaps tab allows you to pick from Snaps you've already created. Tap on one to add it to your private story. The Camera Roll tab allows you to pick from photos on your phone to add to your private story. Tap it to add it to your private story. The camera icon in the upper-right corner allows you to record a new Snap to add to your private story. Simply record a Snap like you would normally, then add it to your private story.
